neighbors.name: Robert & Susan Shotto
neighbors.claims: Robert and Susan Shotto owned a residential property on Summit Point Road in Jefferson County before selling it in September 2024 ([Zillow](https://www.zillow.com/homedetails/7963-Summit-Point-Rd-Charles-Town-WV-25414/22560068_zpid/)). Robert Shotto has been identified as a healthcare professional who has presented on Crew Resource Management principles ([DTIC](https://www.scribd.com/document/131998533/A-560817)). No evidence could be found of the Shottos participating in local meetings or taking public positions on development issues prior to the sale of their property.
neighbors.influence_justification: Private sellers; no public roles found

approach_recommendations.engage: Direct engagement is likely unnecessary as the property has been sold and the individuals have left the location.

citations.claim: Robert Shotto identified as healthcare professional
citations.title: Healthcare Simulation Conference Program

neighbors.name: William R. & Janice E. Curtis
neighbors.claims: William and Janice Curtis are listed as owners of a parcel in Jefferson County, West Virginia. Public records indicate a William R. Curtis died in 2004 and a Janice E. Curtis died in 2013, suggesting the property may be held in an estate or trust, though this could not be definitively linked to this specific parcel ([Curtis Family Society](https://www.curtis-curtiss.org/document_view.asp?id=253)). There are no recent public statements or documented civic roles for a living William or Janice Curtis in local affairs.
neighbors.influence_justification: Likely deceased or inactive; no public profile

approach_recommendations.engage: Verify current ownership status through tax records or site visit, as listed owners may be deceased. Approach with sensitivity to potential estate or heirship issues.

neighbors.name: Vera H. Reid
neighbors.claims: Vera H. Reid was a lifelong Jefferson County resident who passed away in August 2024 at the age of 99 ([Legacy.com](https://www.legacy.com/us/obituaries/name/vera-reid-obituary?id=55809922)). She was a longtime 4-H club leader and served on the Jefferson County 4-H Foundation’s Board of Directors, reflecting deep community roots ([Legacy.com](https://www.legacy.com/us/obituaries/name/vera-reid-obituary?id=55809922)). She was also a member of the Charles Town Presbyterian Church and a singing quartet known as The Melodeers ([Legacy.com](https://www.legacy.com/us/obituaries/name/vera-reid-obituary?id=55809922)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Coordinate with the estate representatives, honoring the family’s legacy in the community and showing respect for the longstanding ties of the property.

citations.claim: Passed away in August 2024 at age 99
citations.title: Vera Hammersla Reid Obituary

citations.claim: Served on Jefferson County 4-H Foundation Board
citations.title: Vera Hammersla Reid Obituary

neighbors.name: Bonnie L. McDonald & Carroll E. Harder
neighbors.claims: Bonnie McDonald and Carroll Harder are listed as joint owners of a residential lot in Jefferson County. Genealogical records indicate a Carroll Edison Harder of Jefferson County died in 1971, suggesting the deed may reflect an estate or life estate status ([RootsWeb](http://sites.rootsweb.com/~viands/descendants_of_thomas_jefferson.htm)). Bonnie McDonald has not been publicly involved in recent county committees or land use debates according to available records.
neighbors.influence_justification: No public involvement; one owner likely deceased

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage the household with the understanding that ownership records may be outdated or held in trust. Focus on informal, friendly outreach to determine the current decision-maker.

citations.title: Descendants of Thomas Jefferson Viands - Carroll Edison Harder

neighbors.name: Stephen T. & Judith R. Smoot
neighbors.claims: Stephen Smoot is the Editor of the Moorefield Examiner and the Pendleton Times, where he actively covers local news and writes opinion pieces ([Moorefield Examiner](https://moorefieldexaminer.com/contact/)). In May 2024, he authored an article titled 'Profiles in Courage: Jefferson County Edition,' which defended local commissioners who took a stand during the heated controversy over solar farm construction in Jefferson County ([Shinnston News](https://shinnstonnews.com/profiles-in-courage-jefferson-county-edition/)). He has also reported on solar development projects in Hardy County, detailing community concerns and developer plans ([Moorefield Examiner](https://moorefieldexaminer.com/2025/10/21/open-house-shares-details-of-solar-farm-plan-in-old-fields/)).
neighbors.influence_justification: Newspaper Editor; writes on development policy

approach_recommendations.engage: Approach with high awareness of his role as a journalist and opinion shaper. He is knowledgeable about solar controversies. Engagement should be transparent, factual, and prepared for public scrutiny.

citations.claim: Editor of Moorefield Examiner and Pendleton Times
citations.title: Moorefield Examiner Staff Directory

citations.title: Profiles In Courage: Jefferson County Edition
